name: David

Rating, 5 stars

Â·

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: From booking to check out, the entire process was easy. The property was so easy to find, near major routes, near local businesses and centrally located without feeling like it was in the midst of everything. The neighborhood has many homes, and this home felt especially private due to the location and the layout of the floor plan. The home is so thoughtfully decorated from the furnishings to linens to dishes. The entire home was spotless, and had everything we needed to feel at home. The owner was available even though we never needed him. The entire stay was a great experience and we would love to stay again in the future. This was our first Airbnb experience, and I am sure that this place has raised the bar! We are so grateful for this opportunity to say "Thanks!" and express on this review how pleased we are! We highly, highly recommend this property for anyone visiting the area (even worth the extra drive if it's a bit out of your way).

review_text:
My family and I have rented Airbnbs worldwide, and this home ranks in the top 1%! Its beauty, pristine condition, and ideal location â€“ nestled in a quiet cul-de-sac yet close to dining and shopping â€“ make it exceptional.
The house has a lot of space with luxurious amenities, including a spacious common area and three cozy bedrooms. The festive and inviting back porch was neat, perfect for evening relaxation.
Daniel is an amazing host. He is proactive, responsive, and very thoughtful. His personal touches were heart-felt and special to my family. When we walked into the house, we were welcomed by Christmas trees and a holiday wreath, already lit up and festive. What an incredible welcome. It set the tone for the rest of our stay.
I wholeheartedly recommend this home and eagerly anticipate our return. A heartfelt thanks to Daniel for an unforgettable experience.

review_text: Daniel was an absolutely amazing host. His wonderful communication made check in a breeze and he was quick to respond to any issues or concerns. The pictures do not do this place justice!! It is absolutely beautiful. and that goes for everything, from the outdoor patio, to the indoor patio, to each room of the home itself. I was able to cook my entire thanksgiving feast in his kitchen. I brought many things from my own kitchen with me, as I was not sure what his kitchen would have in it. However, I ended up needing very little of what I brought as his kitchen was plenty stocked with all sorts of kitchen amenities and tools. The home was warm and inviting and Daniel was an excellent host. I truly can't say enough good things about him and his home. This is the only place we'll be staying when we're in town. I'm certain you won't regret your stay either :)

Stayed with kids
review_text: My family and I had booked a room at one of the hotels down the street and it was just awful so I went on air bnb to see what I could get at the last minute. I found this place and a couple others. I signed in and signed up for two days stay here. Then there came the wait for approval, which was sent to me in less than 5 minutes, maybe less! They sent me the door code and a very friendly message. We went there and checked ourselves in. The place smelled so good. The kitchen was stocked with items to use to cook, but not very many items to eat. The dishes appeared to be spotless, as well as the kitchen and living room area. The downstairs half bathroom was clean and well stocked with hand soap and toilet paper. My daughter loved the automatic soap dispenser, which is in every bathroom, and this place has 3! Upstairs, there are 2 rooms with 1 queen bed and 2 full bathrooms! Also well stocked and super clean! Bed were comfortable. Loved the area, friendly neighbors. Donâ€™t wait to book!

review_text: Without a doubt, we'll return to this property. Suzanne was the most gracious host. The home had everything one could need when away. It was so warm, super clean, and cozy. We had one question upon our arrival about the house. Within minutes, Suzanne and her husband responded and met the request. I told her I was cold natured and needed a lot to warm. My hubby and I left to get dinner. When we returned, there was an electric blanket and a new pair of foot warmers at our door. She set the bar on hospitality. That is something money can't buy but is worth more than anything. Again, we'll certainly stay again when we come back to visit our Marine. Thank you, Suzanne and family, for opening your home to us. The Sanders, from Nashville, TN

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The host ( Suzanne ) was very accommodating, we traveled a very long way to see our son graduate from his schooling on the New River Air Station. By the time we finally got into town we had already been up / awake and in transit for about 24hrs. The stated check-in time i believe was 4pm..i messaged her to ask if it would be ok if we checked in 4 hrs earlier at 12:00 noon, Suzanne was very quick to reply and she said that would be fine. In advance of our arrival she turned on the AC for us so that the room would be nice and cool. Everything about the room was in excellent condition, the bed was very comfortable, everything was very clean. Everything you could possibly need to survive is inside of the unit. Cooking, cleaning, bathroom supplies, linens, towels etc, etc. The TV is a "smart TV" and it also has a Firestick hooked up to it, so you can have access to all kinds of programming. Theres a strong wi-fi signal in the unit.
The neighborhood is excellent, very nice homes, everyone seems to take pride in ownership. The proximity to MCAS New River and Camp Lejeune and all of the things that Jacksonville offer could not be better. The room is above a detached garage that is next to the owners residence. We never heard so much as a peep from anyone at the house, nor any road noise. The street directly in front of the house has a very low volume of traffic, and its in a upper end residential area, so the speed limit is slow and in general the folks driving by tend to be more mature and respectful of their neighbors, hence we never heard any racket coming from the street. Excellent stay 10 out of 10!

review_text:
This AirBnB is wonderful! Staying here was an unforgettable experience. This was our first experience with AirBnB, we're certain that we'll remember this as our finest stay ever.
We really loved the room. It was beautifully appointed, spacious, clean, well-lighted and accommodating. The linen was especially luxurious. We commented that this was like a luxury hotel room that felt just like home.
The coffee in the morning we brewed allowed us to slowly and luxuriously start the day. The USMC cups were a great touch and shows the care the hosts put into preparing the room. We didn't want to leave that morning and wish we could have stayed for several more days.
There is an inviting courtyard down the stairs from the large 2nd floor room. The separate outside stairway and entrance made coming and going a breeze.
We couldn't recommend this AirBnB more highly. It completely exceeded our expectations.

review_text: This apartment was exactly what we expected it to be. Very spacious and clean. Kathy was a great host. Returned phone calls and messages promptly. Although the apartment caters mainly to military personnel, my family stayed there to enjoy the beaches. This place is strategically located within a 1/2 hour from several beaches. North Topsail, Surf City, Topsail, Emerald Isle, Indian Beach, and Atlantic Beach, all within a pretty short car ride. But what sold us was that the cost of this apartment was a fraction of what it would have cost to stay anywhere on the NC Coast. Well worth a short car ride for those who are on a budget.
